job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Edinburg, TX
pros: Lots of opportunities on-campus to work as a student. Most employers are understanding of your class/work schedule. Will be flexible with you whenever you need to study for exams and/or assignments.
cons: No negative comments, but do make sure to turn in your timesheets on time! If not, your payment will be scheduled for the next allocated cycle on the payroll calendar.

pros: Salary, Convenient and flexible working hours
cons: Hard location, demanding and sometimes daunting tasks

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Edinburg, TX
pros: - Flexible with hours - Able to learn about various equipment and techniques - It a head start to learn and practice knowledge learned in class - Pay is above par, one of the best undergraduate paying jobs
cons: There are not many downsides to this job. Just be sure that research is something you'd like to pursue, because if you don't love it, you might hate the lab setting/work.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistantship in Edinburg, TX

cons: I have yet to find any. The pay is ok.

review_title: Decent Wage for Grad Students but Still Needs Work
job_title: Graduate Assistant Instructor in Edinburg, TX
pros: I am grateful that the graduate college allows students to gain teaching experience, and fortunately, I did have teaching experience in public schools prior to this role. I was given a lot of liberty in designing the lessons, and my supervisor was helpful in approving the syllabus and giving advice and modest support along the way, however, I can only speak from my experience and do not know if other GAIs had the same flexibility. I also appreciated that I got to pick my teaching days and could work on the lesson plans on my own time.
cons: As a master's student, I noticed the pay was less for master's students compared to ph.d. students even though we were doing the same work. I also was not offered support, such as a Teaching Assistant, so I often felt overwhelmed doing the lesson planning, creating lessons, and grading for 70+ students for numerous assignments each semester.

pros: Build relationships with different companies great work schedule

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Edinburg, TX

pros:
Special employee tuition rate - great if you want to attend classes here. 
As most jobs, it just depends on whether you get a supportive manager. 
Some departments have some, others don't. If you do get a supportive manager you'll likely stay.
cons: Pay can be better, pay is also mostly concentrated in upper administration. The average salary is $61k as per another salary website that pulls ALL salary info from payroll, but don't expect to make that unless you are a director or in a position higher than that. Upper admin salaries SERIOUSLY skew the average salary for all staff. Promotions are also notoriously hard to come by, but again, this depends solely on the department you are in. The university is moving away from remote work.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Edinburg, TX
pros: The professors are always there for helping, most of them want you to succeed so make any questions you have.
cons: It can be very boring somedays so make sure you are interested in the department/professors research topic.

review_title: Good place to work as a student

pros: Flexibility, good pay, interacting with other students
cons: It can suck to find parking, it gets flooded pretty badly when it rains

pros: Friendly work schedule for students
cons: Unpredictable work requirement based on need

review_title: Great opportunities to learn and develop professionally
pros: UTRGV has a mission to support and empower not only students, but employees and the community. There are endless opportunities to work here and there is always new trainings and events available to attend that will help you develop professionally and can help in your home life as well. Not to mention, they work very well with employees attending school and even promote higher education for their staff by offering employee scholarships and other programs.
cons: The only con I can think of is the PARKING! Make sure to get there early in order to find a parking spot. If you park far, there is always a shuttle, but be sure to know the stops/ times.

pros: benefits, and salary, hours are good

review_title: Research university with talented students and professors

pros: Work with your hours, great people, decent pay.

pros: Good place to work and good benefits.
cons: Nothing bad to say about it.

pros: Anchor institute for the Valley. People. Main staff is friendly and helpful. Student body that works hard despite obvious barriers to success for a border institution serving predominantly Hispanic population.
cons: Every department or college is for itself. A lot of taking ideas from others and running with it. Low morale, severe budget cuts, complete departments wiped out. More pink slips to come. Talk the talk, but don't walk the walk. One vision--the med school is the star and darling.  Alto of travel between campuses (>1hr apart) with minimal reimbursements of your personal vehicle. Lower than typical federal rate by half. All money has been invested in the big guns and not mainline staff and faculty. Trying to catch up with the rest of the UT system.

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Edinburg, TX
pros: Like most universities, Pan Am has a lot of employment opportunities for students. As an engineering undergraduate and graduate student both, there was a plethora of research opportunities for buffing up a resume and easing financial burdens.
cons: Like with most student research positions, they were almost exclusively part-time and often called for full-time dedication to the research or project. If the research did not provide successful results, grant funding is pulled, the project cancelled and the students staff unemployed come next semester.

review_title: Peers are kind, but the offices seem disconnected
pros: Peers are kind and are genuinely helpful once you personally know them. A few instructors are nasty to staff members and act like they are "above the rest," but most are very helpful and want to help the most important people... the students!
cons: "Red-Tape" everywhere it seems. Processes take too long to get your job done. One office tells you one thing, and the other office tells you another. Can't seem to get the same message through.  Pay is low for staff members.

review_title: So sad that they keep people that are so negative about it and the institution; yet lose good hard working people
pros: Good benefits - people afraid of speaking up due to all the changes going on.
cons: So sad that they keep people that are so negative about it and the institution; yet lose good hard working people

pros: They have top of the line teacher who really focuse on child development. As a teacher assistant I gained so much knowledge that would help me in my career after college. I am extremly thankful for all they have done for me personally and for the students that attend UTRGV.
cons: There are no cons to this place. Both management and teacher work extremly hard to provide the best care for the children.

pros:
Get to know university policies and procedures. 
Are able to break out of your shell and talk to people. 
Gives you great experience in the workplace while attaining your bachelor’s. 
Works around your class schedule. 
Contracts usually lasts a year which is rare in other university departments.
cons:
Since it’s customer service job, students are rude to you at times. 
The academic advisors are toxic at times.

pros: Not everyone might have the same experience depending on their department, but I love working here. My colleagues are wonderful, my boss is amazing, and the salary and location pair well together so that you can live very comfortably. All in all a great place to work.
cons: Its hard to get promoted to a more permanent position if you graduated from here, but there are ways around that as well.

pros: As a work study, was able to create my own schedule and have flexibility. It was very convenient to work on campus. It was easy to work in a new field and gained new skills. Understanding supervisors.
cons: It was difficult to get work study awards. Office of financial aid really didn't know who had work study or when it would be available. Only had a limited number of hours to work. Minimum wage.

review_title: Reliable and Great Place to Work!
job_title: Biology Teaching Assistant in Edinburg, TX
pros: UTPA was a convenient place to work since I was taking classes, it was also close to my home, and I had easy relations with my superiors.
cons: Most problems were with communications between other departments and assuring that enough supplies were ordered and delivered by the time they were needed.

review_title: Nice people and place to work, but needs work with salaries
pros: Students are friendly; fellow library staff and faculty are nice.   Campus is pleasant.  Benefits such as health insurance are great.
cons: Compensation is not ideal.  Wage / salary increases for employees are rare.  Salary inversion for faculty and professional staff is an issue.

review_title: Poor upper management and lack of planning make jobs harder than they need to be
pros: The job is fairly straightforward, you get what you put into it. They will pay for some very good certifications like ITIL.
cons: Definitely a place where they willing and able will get drowned with more and more work while those who are lazy will continue to collect a paycheck

review_title: Graduate Assistant for the Center of Online Learning
pros: Having the opportunity to be apart of the center of online learning as a graduate assistant provided such a great insight on technology and new techniques on how to convert, edit, and design courses. Every time I felt stuck-I knew I was able to reach out to any one of my supervisors for help.
cons: No Cons. I had a positive experience

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Brownsville, TX
pros:
A lot of flexibility with working hours. 

Learned a lot about my field.

Learn about what you like and dislike about your field.
cons:
The pay isn't great but it's better than nothing.

There is a lot of work and that is expected. However the work needed to be done in unattainable deadlines. Then more work would be added to this thus, having less time for all tasks.

pros: A new school with room for growth. Provides great opportunities to minorities.
cons: Communication channels are poor. Staff in key administrative positions do not seem to know what they're doing, lack initiative. Salary inequity. Difficult to advance within a position (e.g., salary increase within salary range doesn't happen too often, if at all). However, the university is working hard to address all salary related issues.

pros: Great student body to work with. Has made efforts to hire faculty yearly, although not always in most needed area.
cons: Only two (2% or less) merit raises in 10 years. Now made it harder to get them and to get promotions. Junior faculty are under tenure stress, which is sad

review_title: Self set hours and great side pay
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Edinburg, TX
pros: Get to work with students and sharpen your own knowledge by teaching others. Get to set own TA hours and things are very flexible and accommodating.
cons: On some semesters, the TA course load may be a lot to handle while taking classes. Though recently, more TAs have been hired to share the load of classes.

review_title: Good job for while you attending college
pros: Work is schedule to fit your class schedule
cons: It is quite the hustle to turn in time cards, and supervisors are normally busy so in occasions, if the timecard is not accepted on time, the check jumps a cycle which leaves you without pay till the following payment cycle.

pros: You gain hands on experience. You can work on different types of projects. The staff is really helpful. Everyone is willing to help you if you don't understand something.
cons: You work more than what you get paid. You will sometimes get in trouble for something you didn't do. Some co-workers will be rude and not helpful.

pros: The staff has been very supportive and helpful. The administrators are available and happy to assist when needed. I enjoy working here and feel like part of the family!
cons: 2-hour lunches but at the same time helpful when you need to run errands or be somewhere.

pros: The people are great to work with and there are great teams to be made. There's the exposure to Doctors who are like mentors to young students in various subject areas.
cons: With the merging of campuses and universities, budgets have been cut and coworker relations across these campuses and universities still needs work.

pros:
The health benefits are excellent but getting time off from work to use your benefits will be nearly impossible. 

BCBS/TRS/DELTA DENTAL/SUPERIORVISION
cons: The Child Development Center is simply not a good place to work at, it's got a hostile work environment, the Director lacks leadership skills and uses a lot of favoritism amongst the team. The Director is usually never available, therefore she is not aware of daily news/issues. The salary is very low compared to other Centers.

review_title: It is really awesome working at UTPA. The town is nice little one and one of the fastest growing town
pros: As it is very close to the border and mostly hispanic population, it is easy to get collaboration with big univerisities through NSF like funding
cons: If you do not have project then there is no money

pros: They have a lot of flexibility when it comes to help students. You are a student first, then an employee.
cons: The pay is not great, before you were paid monthly, now you are paid bimonthly.

review_title: Great Environment and Great Opportunities for resume building
pros: Had a flexible schedule for my duties as an academic assistant and always worked closely with my professor to deliver the best duties to students.
cons: Pay may not be great for those with bills, but for sure a great experience to place in your resume

pros: Supervisors and colleagues were very friendly. They help you out to fulfill your tasks.
cons: There is limited learning and promotion opportunity. However it is OK for people looking for short or part time position.

pros: The staff and administration are very pleasant and helpful. Great environment, wonderful staff, and flexible schedule,
cons: At this point, I haven't experienced any downside to working at Brightwood. I will have to supplement my response to this question if the need arises.

pros: great benefits, salary adjustments, holidays off, good employment development workshops,
